If the initial condition \\( z_0 \\) is transformed by \\( g(z) \\) at t = 0, and then allowed to evolve under \\(\\dot{z} = Mz\\) without further intervention, will the state \\( z(t) \\) at a later time t = T be equivalent to directly evolving \\( z_0 \\) under \\(\\dot{z} = Mz\\) to t = T?
Explanation: The initial application of the transformation \\( g(z) \\) by \\( e^{Dt} \\) modifies the original state \\( z_0 \\), creating a new initial condition. Since the system's evolution is sensitive to initial conditions and \\( e^{Dt} \\) can significantly alter the trajectory based on the structures of D and M, the state at time T will be different.
